i: Caseless: letters in the pattern match both upper and lower case letters
s: Dot-all: a dot metacharacter in the pattern matches all characters, including newlines.
x: Extended: whitespace data characters in the pattern are totally ignored except when escaped or inside a character class, and characters between an unescaped # outside a character class and the next newline character, inclusive, are also ignored.
U: Ungreedy: This modifier inverts the "greediness" of the quantifiers so that they are not greedy by default, but become greedy if followed by ?
X: Extra: Any backslash in a pattern that is followed by a letter that has no special meaning causes an error, thus reserving these combinations for future expansion.
u: UTF-8: pattern strings are treated as UTF-8.
J: DUPNAMES: Allow duplicate names for subpatterns
